intro: Goniophlebium colpodes, commonly known as the narrow-leafed liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, leaf-like structures that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest floors or on rocky surfaces. Its reproductive structures, known as gametophytes, are prominently displayed on the leaf surfaces. Goniophlebium colpodes plays a vital role in ecological systems by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for microorganisms.
